Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: BALocke
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this property. Very clean and updated interior. Staff is outstanding. Great manager's reception and breakfast in the am. Close to shops and easy access to the freeway. By far, one of my most favorite properties.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent property”
Reviews.Author: JtravelAZ
Reviews.Content: Located off I-17 next to a large shopping and dining complex. This residence Inn is a newer property with stainless steel kitchen appliances and Granite counter tops. well appointed rooms with a Large bathroom area and a very comfortable bed. every residense I have stayed always has a very fresh and inviting scent to the units when you walk in. I don't know what they use but more hotels should use this product. The Pool and wirlpool area is large and inviting as is the courtyard area outside the pool area. They have a gas barbarque availabe for guests use here as well. Complementary Breakfast is excellent with enough choices to please everyone. Staff was very friendly and helpful. This is a Great place to stay when in the area

Reviews.Title: “superb location”
Reviews.Author: griswolds09
Reviews.Content: new, clean, fresh and quiet residence inn on the outskirts of phoenix in a newly developed area close to i-17. a huge shopping district devided by a highway is in walking distance with tons of shops and restaurants. anthem outlet mall is located only a few minutes up north i-17. it was a great stay with a great manager's reception in the evening and breakfast the next morning. outdoor pool is shared with an adjacent courtyard and can get crowded. shade falls in large part of pool area already early in the afternoon (july perception). overall a perfect choice if you prefer the space of an apartement over a hotelroom. will stay here next time, when in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel ... Always stay there when I travel to Phx”
Reviews.Author: RJP333
Reviews.Content: Beautiful property with wonderful amenities and the staff is fantastic! I travel to Phoenix regularly and I’ve stayed at 10-15 different properties and this is by far my first choice. I go out of my way to stay here because the rooms are always perfect, the property is extremely clean, and the service is unmatched. The hotel is also close to shopping, restaurants, movie theaters, and recreational areas.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: iluv2trvl93
Reviews.Content: Checked in the day before Easter and my mom had asked about places to go to church for Sunday morning service. Mara the front desk receptionist recommended CCV which was amazing. The morning complimentary breakfast was great; staff varied the breakfast items so it wasn't the same old thing every day - had both hot/cold items which we appreciated since we stayed there for 5 days. Also on Tuesday night had complimentary dinner-chicken lasagne was yummy & on Wednesday night they had BBQ night - hotdogs/chicken was good. Front desk staff were all very helpful; daily papers always available. Lobby internet was about the same speed as mine at home. Exercise room was open 24hr a day & was clean & all machines had working tv access. Pool was refreshing & sauna/whirlpool helped aching muscles from long airplane ride. Nice room with kitchenettes, although we didn't cook-we utilized the regular size refrig for all our leftovers. Nice bedding & plenty of towels provided. Would definitely recommend to others!

Reviews.Title: “Very Bad Internet”
Reviews.Author: KewlDood
Reviews.Content: Though I have some good points about this place of stay, I was extremenly disappointed by the internet speed at this hotel which is at snails pace at any time of the day. The manager seems to blame it on the limited internet bandwidth like any marketing personnel would do. I would highly recommend any professionals carrying their laptops not to choose this place. Otherwise, rooms are good for the price you pay. Staffs at the hotels are a mixture of snobs and pleasance.

Reviews.Title: “WE RECOMMEND IT”
Reviews.Author: MrsMidwest
Reviews.Content: Our experience was excellent and the accommodations were great. The Residence Inn facility is new, neat and clean, quiet, and well kept. The service was incredible and the hotel staff was very friendly, courteous and helpful. Initially, finding the hotel was a challenge because it is located in such a new area that our gpx navigation system was confused, too. But, we found it pretty quick. Our room was cleaned early each morning (before 10:00) and we really have no complaints whatsoever. Parking spaces are available in front, back and on both sides of the hotel. Breakfast was served in the first floor dining area each morning from 6:00 to 9:00, but we always dined at nearby restaurants instead. There are many fast food restaurants and other stores (including Wal-Mart) located very close to the hotel which is very convenient . The pool area is shared with Courtyard by the Marriott and located between Residence Inn and Courtyard by the Marriott. The pool area is large and well maintained. The exercise room is great and the laundry facilities are adequate and very convenient. The next time we visit Phoenix, we will definitely stay at Residence Inn/Happy Valley.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: travelingbarb2-2
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for several days while visiting family in Phoenix. It was perfect for our needs. The kitchen contained a full-size refrigerator, dishwater and two-burner stove. It was well equipped with, among other items, utensils, toaster, full-size coffee maker, dish towels, dishes and bowls, glasses (not plastic) and even sharp knives. They thought of everything! The dining table and large desk were handy. The living/kitchen area was completely separated from the bedroom with doors, not with just partial walls as in some other so-called suite hotels. There were two good-sized closets and a vanity area separated from the toilet and shower room by a door. There were large TV's in the living area and bedroom. The breakfast wasbetter than most hotel buffet breakfasts that I've experienced. Particularly enjoyed being able to make my own waffles and there were several selections of hot food each day. The front desk staff and breakfast service persons were friendly and helpful. Although it was too cold to use it, the pool was large and attractive. The self service laundry was nice, although we did not need use it. The hotel and the rooms are very attractive. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Clean, Convenient, New”
Reviews.Author: fourdoor
Reviews.Content: Great mid-range hotel. All new, very clean, and the decor is welcoming and nice. This hotel shares a pool with a Courtyard by Marriott (also new), which is on the same lot and a bit less expensive. Our room and the kitchen in it were very nice, hotel employees were helpful, and we were happily surprised to get a free, warm breakfast buffet daily with the room. The hotel is conveniently located in a huge new shopping area, which includes, e.g., a WalMart grocery store, Lowes, Barnes and Noble, Starbucks, and a bunch of other restaurants, stores and theaters. The hotel is very convenient to the highway (Interstate 17). Took us about 25 minutes without traffic to get from the airport car rental place to the hotel (get off on Exit 218). Interestingly, though, our GPS system could not find the hotel, presumably because the area is so new. I'd stay here again. Nice, clean place, easy to get to. fourdoor

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: biztravellerEngland
Reviews.Content: When travelling on business I prefer hotels with kitchen facilities so booked this as it was reasonably close to work. I normally consider Residence Inn comfortable but don't particularly look for them over other brands. It just so happened this was closest to work with the room facilities I like. I really enjoyed this hotel, it is pretty new so feels clean and fresh, the staff were very helpful in advising local restaurants and the facilities were excellent. Complimentary breakfast was good with a decent selection (if a little samey after 2 weeks), the gym was reasonable and pool a decent size. There is an attached Marriott Courtyard with a bar if you need a beer, although the managers reception (Mon to Wed) has a selection of beers and wine. The WiFi access was free and resonably fast, but tended to slow down in the evening - just the numbers accessing it I guess. Overall this was an excellent hotel at the price, not a 5* hotel but 5* for what it gave at the price - recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, though can be a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: roomcritic
Reviews.Content: This is a new hotel and the decor is very nice. We stayed in room 418 (a 2 bedroom) for a week and the room is nice, the grounds are very clean, breakfast is good and the pool is huge and uncrowded. Also a very nice a exercise room with airconditioning. The staff at this hotel is great - very helpful and knowledgeable. The only complaint I have about this hotel is that all the 2 bedroom suites are located directly above the sports center (tennis courts, basketball court) and people are allowed to use this area until 11 p.m. What happens is that teenagers use it as a skateboard park and gathering place so we heard loud voices, yelling, loud laughter, basketball games and tennis matches up until 11 o.m. every night. The staff tries their hardest to keep the noise down, but there are people using this sports court at night who are not staying there - people who have just jumped the fence to use the pool, the covered tables and the sports court, so it is hard for the staff to man the front desk and keep track of what is going on in the courtyard. It would be better if they kept the sports court open until 7 p.m. and then closed it. Because of this, we would most likely not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perhaps my BEST Marriott Experience YET!”
Reviews.Author: april247
Reviews.Content: I was actually bumped from one Residence Inn in Glendale and moved 21 miles away to the Happy Valley Location. At first I was pretty mad, and did let anyone on the other end of an 800 number know. However after staying at the hotel, I have to say this was the best Marriott experience I have ever had. Maybe it was because I had complained so much before arriving, or perhaps the hotel is just that great. The rooms are very spacious, the staff is more than spectaular and I cannot say one bad thing about this hotel, besides location. It was somewhat far from the stadium, and the fair grounds the reasons for my trip. However once I got over the mileage, my overall exeperience at the hotel was exceptional. I would stay here again in an instant.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: oconnors
Reviews.Content: Lovely clean, modern hotel, everything still seems new. Staff were friendly. We stayed in a one-bedroom suite, finished to a high quality. The kitchen was well-equipped with all the necessaries- fridge, hob, oven, microwave, delph etc. and must not forget the dishwasher! The bed was very comfortable, with crisp clean linens. There was a second television in the bedroom. The bathroom had a separate vanity area with a second closet. You also won’t need to bring an iron or hairdryer with you as they are provided. This is probably common and maybe some of you are going ‘duh!’ but being from Europe I found this to be refreshing, as when I travel in Europe I always need to bring one because more often than not no iron is provided! The breakfast, which was included, was very good. If you wanted to make waffles, batter and a waffle maker were available. Just make note that this hotel is located outside of Phoenix, making it some distance from Phoenix’s main attractions. However, it’s convenient to access I 17 and 101. There is a shopping mall very close by with restaurants, a cinema and shops. I didn’t know this until I arrived but the hotel will do grocery shopping for you and have it in for when you arrive. I think this is a great facility. A Wal-Mart is close by if you fancy doing your own shop. There is also a gym, which seemed well equipped, I just looked not used! However, I did use the self-service laundry room. You need you’re room key to access it. It has 3 or 4 washing machines and about the same number of dryers. It costs $1 and detergent is available from reception at no extra charge. And speaking of charges, there were none for the bottled water left in the room or for wireless internet access. We had a very comfortable stay here and would definitely recommend it if being outside of Phoenix wasn’t an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: DianefromCanada
Reviews.Content: Absolutely wonderful hotel!!!! Huge 2 bedroom, new, beautiful suite! Awesome hot breakfast included. Great pool, tennis court, and basketball court! We had a awesome 3 day stay with our three boys aged 14,11 and 9. I would highly recommend this hotel for families. Close to awesome shopping and restaurants. Minutes from the Golfland Waterslides. Great price, location and service.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant place to stay”
Reviews.Author: deerledge
Reviews.Content: Everything in the hotel was brand new. The beds were heavenly! Crisp linens and very comfy. The staff were all very helpful and courteous. The breakfast spread in the mornings was very good... hot things were hot and cold things were cold. The hotel is located north of Phoenix and has very easy access to I17. There was a great shopping center near the hotel that had everything.... clothing, resturants etc.... The pool at the hotel was great, the fitness room was very well equipped and the guest laundry was inexpensive and clean. If I may, I would like to recommend Cartwright's Steakhouse in Cave Creek. Out of this world!!! Check their website for menus. We always stay at Residence Inn if there is one where we are traveling. This one ranks in the top 3 for us.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: shrop
Reviews.Content: As long as the location doesn't matter (it's quite a way north of Phoenix) to you this property is great. All still pretty new so the accommodation is a very good standard, staff are welcoming and you feel comfortable with great beds. It's close enough to shops and restaurants ( a little limited) so you should find what you want. Breakfast could be better, the choice is limited and not that inviting so some improvements could be made there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, Service, Amenities at the Residence Inn”
Reviews.Author: pranpran
Reviews.Content: Hotel just opened. Went for superbowl. Service beyond belief and everyone was so nice. Food @ breakfast (included) fresh and adequate. The room was set up just right (1 BR suite) and they didn't charge for "extras" like internet and supplies for well-equipped kitchen. The work-out room was top quality and pool was well-maintained. I forgot my glasses and they overnighted them to me @ no charge. Very quiet and all the systems worked well. Staff either knowledgeable or, alternatively, resourceful about the area. Recommend it for anyone.

HotelInfo.Name: Residence Inn Phoenix North/Happy Valley
HotelInfo.Address: 2035 West Whispering Wind Drive, Phoenix, AZ 85085
